intro: Scalesia baurii subsp. baurii, commonly known as the Baur's tree heather, is a species of flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, coastal areas with rich, well-drained soil. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, clustered inflorescences of white or pale yellow flowers. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is known for its adaptability to the unique ecological conditions of the Galápagos. Due to its restricted habitat and vulnerability to environmental changes, it is considered an important species for conservation efforts in the region.
